H0.text: Heat and light are the two forms of energy that could best be used to increase the temperature of a sheet of copper.

H1.text: Heat and sound are the two forms of energy that could best be used to increase the temperature of a sheet of copper.

H2.text: Light and magnetism are the two forms of energy that could best be used to increase the temperature of a sheet of copper.

H3.text: Electricity and sound are the two forms of energy that could best be used to increase the temperature of a sheet of copper.

A4.text: Heat is energy in transfer between a system and its surroundings by mechanisms other than thermodynamic work and transfer of matter.
